result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandra J. Richling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sandra J. Richling is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sandra J. Richling was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $300.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Kathleen Basquez or her residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  Comply with installment agreement with Insurance Company.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandra J. Richling

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B VanCuick.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes and stays sentence of 6 months jail; deft is placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions; restitution ordered in the amount of $300 (by stipulation of deft).
per ADA Delgado the case is resolved, the JS of 2/29/16 at 8:30am is change to a PLEAS.

State's other acts motion, motion to amend information and motion to preclude expert testimony at trial. Deft waives right to Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Atty King acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 6/25/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA McNeill. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. Atty. King moves to dismiss complaint. Court denies motion. KPD Officer Andrew Skowronski sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. King. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-27-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
